subtitles_text: >> JEFF PROBST: The South
Pacific. Thousands of islands
lay scattered across the world's most beautiful ocean.
But for centuries, man has traveled these waters to meet
in combat. From brutal tribal warfare to
the the epic battles of World War II, this is a place where
rivals have long traveled to settle old scores.
It is the perfect setting for our biggest showdown yet.
Welcome to the 20th season of Survivor.
Over the past ten years, Survivor has traveled to some
of the most desolate, dangerous and exotic places
in the world. (bird calling)
Over 300 people have tested themselves in the most
difficult and groundbreaking show on television.
We have gathered 20 of them to play one more time.
These are ten of your favorite heroes...
versus ten of the most notorious villains.
>> In my world, I've always tried to show that good
will win. >> I'm a villain.
I think villains are smarter than heroes because they don't
mind stabbing somebody in the back to get where they want
to get. It's a fact.
It's a proven fact. Google it.
>> The Heroes are definitely people I would rather play the
game with. The Villains are the people
I've always been against. So this is perfect for me to be
on the heroes' side and battle it out against these punks I
don't like anyway. >> I've been labeled things
like "She-devil in a blue bikini," "The wicked witch of
the West." "Man-eater Manthey"-- that was
my favorite one. (chuckles)
>> I'm back here to do what I came to do the first time-- get
to the end and make the money. So I'm definitely coming back
to redeem myself. >> This time, I slay everyone
and trust no one. This is my chance for
redemption. >> I'm not in the shape I was
last time, but I still think that I could hang in there as
tough as any guy next to me. >> But these people are
smart, they'll get rid of me right right away.
It's the smartest thing they could do, but they won't.
They never do. >> I'm almost a decade older
than I was the first time. So to me, it's a test to see if
I still got it. >> Last time I was mean, and
this time I'm meaner. You know, I'll lie.
I don't care. But I'll make up a good lie.
>> People think they know me. They really don't know me.
(laughing) I'm a gangster in a Oprah suit.
But I'm not, like, a mean gangster.
I'm a nice gangster with a smile, you know.
>> PROBST: it is still the ultimate challenge:
20 people forced to work together while battling the
elements and each other. They must learn to adapt or
they'll be voted out. In the end, only one will
remain to claim the million-dollar prize.
39 days, 20 people, one survivor.
(theme song playing) \xe2\x99\xaa \xe2\x99\xaa
>> Flying in the choppers, my heart's beating a mile a minute.
I'm sitting right next to Tom and Cirie and all these people.
I know the game's going. I'm finally back in the game.
>> Flying in on the helicopter, you can feel something
in the air. There's an electricity.
There's a tension. There's a level of excitement
that is coursing through everybody's veins,
especially mine. And to start off like that, I
think sets a great tone for how the season is gonna be.
>> Believe it or not, I'm a little nervous going in.
I'm still in awe of who I'm here with.
I mean, for God's sake, Boston Rob...
Parvati. I mean, you know, I gotta
get my mind straight and not let them get me too starstruck.
I'm out here playing a game with them now.
>> I'm nervous and I'm excited. And, you know, like before you
bungee jump or something, you get that knot in your stomach,
and it, like, makes you want to throw up, kind of?
That's how I feel right now. >> I look over and see my
fellow tribemates with the blue buff on getting out of their
copter and running over. It's pretty intense, you know?
My tribe, the Heroes tribe, they're hard-working, you know,
tough guys, good people. I was like, you know,
"This is it." I can't wait to kick some
ass out here. \xe2\x99\xaa \xe2\x99\xaa
>> Here we are, we're on our nice little blue mat, and then
here come these Villains, and you see, you see Boston Rob,
and he's already got the whole, the walk and the swagger and
the attitude. And then, you know, you see
Coach and Jerri. I mean, they really
are villains. >> Yay!
I'm the original villainess of Survivor and I gotta tell you
I feel like Mother Teresa right now with these people.
(laughs) It's on.
>> PROBST: All right, let me officially welcome you to
Survivor 20: Heroes vs. Villains.
(laughter) >> Yeah, baby! Whoo!
>> PROBST: Ten years, 20 seasons, over 300 people have
played Survivor, the greatest adventure game in the history
of television. Russell, how does it feel to be
deemed one of the ten most notorious of all time?
>> I'm still in awe that I'm here with...
with all these great players. Finally, I can play the game.
with somebody that respects the game.
>> PROBST: Boston Rob, you proud to be seen as one of the
ten biggest villains of all time?
>> I'm a villain? (all laughing)
Well, it's all in perspective, I guess.
It's how you see it. >> PROBST: Rupert, a lot of
people have played this game. >> Yup.
>> PROBST: You're still, to this day, one of the
most popular. >> Uh, it's, it's been
an honor since the first time that I got to play.
And now when I found out I'm on the Heroes' side, I tell
you, I love the game, and being able to have this chance,
it's, it's an honor. >> PROBST: Tom, another big
hero, played a very solid game. A lot of people like you.
They were happy you won, which isn't always the case with some
of our winners. Stack up these two tribes.
>> You know, we kind of got maybe some positive energy
going just 'cause we've been labeled the good guys, but, um,
I also wouldn't assume that anybody would stick with the
game-play that they had. If it didn't work for them in a
previous season, I would say that they might do a 180 on this
thing and spin it around, and I think that could be from
either tribe. >> PROBST: Colby, in your
season, Survivor: Australia, our second season,
going back almost ten years ago, you were so popular, people
were naming their children "Colby."
(laughter) >> Most of the ones I heard
about named their dogs "Colby." (laughter)
So a kid's not bad. I'll take that.
>> PROBST: What's the perspective now, almost
ten years later? >> It's taken me almost this
long to really get enough perspective to appreciate it,
and this is, this is my third time back, and it is,
it is humbling. It's the experience and it's
the adventure. If you're not fired up at this
point riding in on those birds, you don't have a pulse.
>> PROBST: J.T., is it at all intimidating, even within
your own tribe, when you look around at who's
surrounding you? >> It's definitely intimidating.
I watched these people when I was in high school.
I was too young to apply for the show, so I couldn't do it,
and now I'm out here competing against them.
And I'm still a rookie out here. I'm probably the youngest one
out here. I feel like a young kid against
these people, but I'm ready. >> PROBST: Anybody out here
feel they are on the wrong tribe, legitimately feel
they're on the wrong tribe? >> Oh, yeah.
>> What'd we do? >> Yeah, what did we do?
>> What did we do that was so bad?
>> PROBST: So pretty much every Villain thinks they should be
on the Hero tribe. (laughter)
Except Jerri Manthey, the original black widow, still
owning her title. >> I even got a black hat for
this season. >> Is there a little symbolism
with her hat being black and mine being white?
>> PROBST: Good versus evil? >> It was not a mistake.
>> PROBST: Parvati, let's be clear; while you did a great
job and were rewarded with a million dollars, you led one of
the most notorious tribe of women ever in the history
of the game. You betrayed people left
and right. You guys were responsible for
many, many blindsides. Great player?
Yes, that's why you're here. Hero? No.
James, from your two cents-- Parvati, hero or villain?
>> Villain. (laughter)
>> PROBST: James is bigger than me.
James is right. >> I will fight him.
I'm not scared of him. (laughs)
I don't care how big you are. >> Uh-huh.
>> PROBST: Anybody here willing to say that the sheer size of
James does make them take pause for a moment?
>> Yes. >> Yes.
>> I don't want to wrestle him. >> Hello?
>> PROBST: James, anybody on the Villain tribe
intimidate you? >> It's the same story every
every time. The talkers are the most
dangerous. The ones who strategize are the
best ones at the game. They-- bar none-- have won most
of the series, most of the seasons.
>> PROBST: So you've learned something in your two times
out here. >> Believe it or not, I have.
>> PROBST: Going back to when you were voted out with two
idols, one in each pocket. (James laughs)
>> Yes, thanks for reminding me. >> PROBST: Boston Rob, how big
a factor is size versus scrap? >> I-I think that we have a huge
advantage over them. Our women are clearly stronger
than their women. And our guys can hold the best
of it. >> Yes, yes.
>> I'm being serious. >> You got the gloves, Jeff?
>> I don't see how they're gonna be able to keep up
with us. I love you, Colby, but, man,
you got the raw end of the stick.
>> I'm so glad he's here. I'm so glad Rob's back.
>> PROBST: So, Rob, nobody on this tribe of Heroes
intimidates you? >> I didn't say that, Jeff.
I just said I think that we have the advantage.
And we're not gonna be busy dealing with all the egos
over there. >> PROBST: All right, well,
we're gonna see how you match up right now.
It's time to get to your first reward challenge.
Here's how it works: you will square off two-on-two.
On my go, both pairs will race out to dig up one bag.
Once you have the bag, you must race back to your finish mat.
That's where it's gonna get physical.
You have four people battling for one bag.
To score a point for your tribe, you have to be touching
the bag and your finish mat at the same time.
First tribe to score three points wins reward.
Want to know what you're playing for?
>> Yeah. >> Yes.
>> PROBST: Well, in addition to the challenges being physical,
the conditions are gonna be demanding as well.
Between the heat and the rain, if you do not stay hydrated,
you will not last long. Fire for the winner of the
first challenge. Having fire ten minutes into
this game gives you a huge advantage going into that first
immunity challenge. You win that challenge, you
have momentum, you could ride that all the way to the end.
I know it's worth playing for. I'm gonna give you a minute
to strategize on your matchups, then we'll get started.
All right, let's get to our first challenge.
The first matchup is going to be Stephenie and Cirie for the
Heroes, taking on Parvati and Danielle for the Villains.
This is the lane you're going Right where I am.
Just come to me. Survivors ready?
Go! There's one bag in this sand.
You've got to find it, and you've got to get back
to your mat. Danielle and Cirie did this
challenge in their season, Exile Island.
They're now opponents in the same challenge.
Cirie has the bag. Cirie and Parvati going at it.
And it's physical quickly. Danielle trying to steal it
from Cirie. >> Come on, Danielle!
Hold onto it, Danielle! >> PROBST: Stephenie and
Danielle now have it. Parvati now has the bag for the
for the Villains. >> Yeah!
>> PROBST: Parvati takes it back from Stephenie, but Stephenie
takes Parvati down. Cirie in on it.
Cirie now and Danielle. Cirie is like a linebacker in
this challenge. Parvati working Stephenie over.
>> Come on, Danielle! >> Come on, Parvi!
>> PROBST: Danielle has the bag for the Villains!
Villains score the first point! Villains lead one-zip.
>> My shoulder. Wait, wait, wait.
>> No. We got medic. He's here. >> No, no, no.
Hold on, hold on. I gotta relax.
>> PROBST: What happened? >> If it's out...
>> What do you want me to do? >> I'm a medical student, and
when I saw Stephenie dislocate her shoulder, I knew she could
leave the game permanently over something like that.
>> PROBST: You want medical look at it?
>> What happens if medical looks at it?
>> PROBST: Stay here, stay here. Medical.
>> Ah! >> Hi.
>> PROBST: Her shoulder's popped out.
>> Yeah, we'll get her down. You can just kneel down for
for me? (Stephenie gasping)
Hold it up. >> PROBST: Hold it up?
Like that? >> Yup.
Just need someone to go over there.
You're all right. >> PROBST: Hang tight, okay?
(Stephenie gasping) (crunch)
>> Oh! Okay. >> Yay!
>> The Villains are brutal. They dislocated my shoulder the
first challenge. I mean, really?
Like, you're already on the Villain tribe, do you have to
act like a total, like, jerk? It's okay now. I just...
>> PROBST: Wow. >> All right, guys, let's go.
>> PROBST: All right, we have played our first point of the
first challenge of Survivor 20, and we have
our first injury. Stephenie's shoulder had
to be popped back into place. Next round is one man,
one woman. It's Amanda and J.T.

Survivors ready? Go!
>> Come on, Jerri! Kick some ass!
>> PROBST: Looking for that bag. then you gotta get back

>> Randy! >> PROBST: Jerri's got it.
Now, it's a battle to get it up. Jerri found it, but she didn't

Pull him down! >> PROBST: Randy and J.T. going

>> PROBST: Nobody has the bag! >> Punch him!
Punch him, punch him! >> PROBST: J.T. has Randy in
some kind of a hold. That's some country right there.
All that work and the bag is still stuck in the sand.
>> Jerri, behind you! >> PROBST: J.T. trying to get
to get it. J.T. has the bag!
Randy get on him! It's one-on-one!
J.T. eludes Randy. We are tied, 1-1.
Here we go, next round, it is Colby and Tom taking on
Coach and Russell. You're coming to lane nine,
the last lane. Survivors ready?
>> You guys got it, you got it. >> PROBST: Go!
Russell digging for the Villains, Tom and Colby digging
for the Heroes. Coach hanging back,
just watching. Not gonna let anybody get a
free sprint to the finish. A big matchup; four
strong guys. Four fit guys.
This will not be an easy path to get back to your mat.
Whoever gets this point is gonna earn it.
>> Russell's got it! >> PROBST: Russell has the bag
for the Villains. Tries to toss it to Coach!
Doesn't work! Colby now has a hand on it!
This is full on. Coach takes Colby over.
Colby's trying to push Coach off.
Coach not having it. >> Hold your bag, Colby!
>> Get on your feet, Tom! >> PROBST: Colby inching

>> PROBST: Russell now trying to get free of Tom.

Coach! Okay, Colby!
>> Come on, Russell! >> PROBST: Colby now dragging
Coach. (Tom groans)
Russell really being tough on on Tom.
Play fair, down there! >> Come on, Tom!
>> PROBST: Colby eyeing that that mat.
>> Come on, Colby! >> PROBST: He's just got to make
sure coach doesn't drag him to the other mat.
>> Keep it up, Coach! >> PROBST: Coach now dragging
Colby. Here comes Tom and Russell!
Coach scores for the Villains! (Colby gasps)
>> Colby getting owned by Coach? Oh, my gosh, dude.
I can only imagine what Colby's thinking.
He's got to be, like, "I may as "well just become a woman,
"because there's no point on "trying to maintain my
masculinity now." >> PROBST: Villains now lead

We are back to women taking on women.
It is Sugar and Candice for the Heroes taking on Sandra
and Courtney. Lane five.
Survivors ready? You're in the right lane.
Heroes need to score. All four women are digging and

>> PROBST: Courtney had it. >> Sandra, get up!
>> PROBST: Candice is holding on to it.
Courtney fighting in there. The smallest woman in this game.
>> Candice, stand up! >> PROBST: Candice now trying

Hold on! Hold on! Hold on! >> PROBST: Candice standing up

>> Come on, Courtney! Hold on! You gotta hold on!
>> PROBST: Candice dragging Courtney toward her mat.

>> Go, Sandra! >> PROBST: Sandra now getting
involved. >> PROBST: Sugar trying to take

>> Sugar, get up! >> Get up, Candice!

The bag is totally free! Sandra undid Sugar's top.
That bag is free, and nobody can get free to get it!
Sugar lets go of her top. Sugar takes the bag!
Sugar gives up vanity and scores for the Heroes.

Sandra earned her title as a Villain for me with the bra

This is it. For the Heroes, James and

This should be a doozy. Come to me right here.

Go! >> Hey, hold up!
Make James work! Stay back! >> Stay away from 'em, Rob.

Rupert digging. Boston Rob is just sticking

>> Good job! >> Hey, hold up!
>> PROBST: Rob now going for the bag!
>> Stay back! >> Stay away from 'em, Rob.
>> Go, Rob! >> PROBST: Rob and James going

Rob. It's James and Rob.
Rob tries to take James, can't do it!
James scores! Heroes win reward!
>> When I came out of that final heat, my toe, instead of going
up and down, went like a "J." My toe is broke.
>> Oh, my God. >> I can feel it.
Not that one, this one. >> We'll fix you with codeine.
(Rupert gasps) >> There we go.
That's stuck in now. >> My toe is broke, and I felt
it cracking inside. But I'm not getting put out of
this game over a damn toe. First damn day.
>> PROBST: All right, so let's do an injury count.
Rupert has a broken toe, Stephenie has a dislocated and
then relocated shoulder. Hopefully, it was worth it.
Big victory for the Heroes. Fire.
And a map to your new home. Villains, you are definitely
living up to your name. Grab your stuff, head to your
camp and start working on on shelter.
>> The Villains lost. You think that really bothers
me, losing? 'Cause I'm used to losing with
a bunch of dummies. But the difference is this
ain't a bunch of dummies. We will win.
And I'm looking forward to sending the Heroes to Tribal
Council and letting them do their hero thing.
>> Look what we've got here. We've got fins.
>> Fins, and is there a sling in here, or not?
>> Fins! >> There's a...
>> Yeah, that's it. >> What?
>> You gotta make your own out of a stick.
>> Make it. >> I can't believe I'm doing
this again. It's just starting to sink in.
I believe I'm going to have to stay on my toes with these
fellas. I'm ready for it.
I'm ready for the challenge. >> I think that we should live
under this tree because it's it's dry.
>> That's what I'm, that's what I'm thinking.
This is, like, the biggest tree right here, right?
>> I am, yeah, really bad. >> Really?
>> I got about ten bites already.
>> They like that dragon blood. (laughter)
>> I got way more to prove right here than I did the
last time. If I could do it here, if I can
take it all the way, if I can whup these all-stars, doesn't
that mean I'm the best ever? >> I'm gonna play similar

They better give it their all and play the game because

I have to work my magic on, on the villain side, which is
gonna be tough. I'm gonna be straight up
with you. >> Yeah.
>> Yeah, so do I. >> I'm an aggressive player.
I'm here to win, and, you know, I want to make smart alliances.
>> The thing is, if we can trust each other and we can do
this... which I trust you. >> Yeah.
>> ...which, I trust you. >> Yeah, I trust you, too.
>> You have to trust me. You have to no matter what.
>> I know. >> Because that's the whole name
of the game. >> I know, I know.
>> And this is where it happens the first day.
This is when it happens. >> Sure, I know.
>> With Russell, he's a great person to play this game with.
He knows exactly what he's he's doing.
I'm going with my gut and I think that I-I should stick with

>> I'll do whatever it takes to get to the top, but what I'm

>> ...is I want to get to the top with you.
>> Yeah. >> We are going to be better of
a pair than you can even possibly imagine.
>> I agree. ...period.
That's what I really, really want.
>> And I can swing it. >> I clearly know that Russell

Are you kidding? He's just an incredible force.
>> I do. >> With Russell, I definitely
feel like I am making a deal with the devil, but I want the

Like Michael Jordan is in basketball, like Michael Phelps

above their sport. And I'm the best player
that ever played this game. Now guess what?
I get to prove it. (chuckles)
>> Sweet! >> All right!
Nice! >> Man, we got a net.

>> A net! Oh, sweet. >> Well, here we are, guys.
>> Here we are. >> Heroes?
>> We're heroes! >> Yeah!
>> Heroes! (laughter)
>> "Return, revenge and redemption."
>> Well... >> All right.
>> Shall we take a celebratory dip?

>> It takes a little bit to get back into the rhythm of

>> You know, the challenge, I think our team showed its
it's strength. Unfortunately, I didn't.

I don't like losing at anything, and I got beat by
Coach. So I'm so rusty on the game,
but I'm having a good time. >> We're making our first group

>> I mean, we can just build something really quick

>> Um, the two oldest men... >> Oh, no, no, no!
>> can we have, can we...? (laughter)
can we just...? >> The two older men, could

>> All right. >> Yay!

>> We know what needs to be done, and we work together,

right. We have good karma right now.
It's great. >> You know what we need?
Like, the post to split the coconut husk on.
You got to get, like, a short, pointy...
(chicken clucking) Thought I heard some clucking,

how about if we have four of us go, like, one, two, and then

>> You got it, man. (chickens clucking)

>> Yeah! Winner, winner, chicken dinner!
>> I have seen my share of chickens, and I've caught my

I don't believe it. >> I know.
